title: X-ray crystallographic structure of the potent antiplasmodial compound 2,7-dibromocryptolepine acetic acid solvate.
abstract:
noThe structure of 2,7-dibromocryptolepine acetic\ud
acid solvate, C16H11N2Br2 [1.5(C2H4O2)][C2H3O2\ud
-]\ud
[0.5H2O], Mr = 460.17, has been determined from X-ray\ud
diffraction data. The crystals are monoclinic, space group\ud
P21/c with Z = 4 molecules per unit cell and a =\ud
7.3243(3), b = 18.7804(6), c = 15.8306(7) A ° , b = 94.279(1) ,\ud
Vc = 2171.5(2) A ° , crystal density Dc = 1.667 g/cm3. The\ud
structure was determined using direct methods and refined\ud
by full-matrix least-squares to a conventional R-index of\ud
0.0496 for 4,908 reflections and 258 parameters. The cryptolepine\ud
nucleus of the 2,7-dibromocryptolepine molecule\ud
is highly planar and the two Br atoms are in this plane\ud
within 0.06 and 0.01 A ° , respectively. The crystal structure\ud
is maintained via hydrogen bonding between N(10) in the\ud
cryptolepine nucleus and the oxygen of one of the three\ud
solvated acetic acid molecules. The acetic acid molecules\ud
also form hydrogen bonded chains. Acetic acid B is\ud
deprotonated and its two C¿O bond lengths are equivalent,\ud
unlike those in A and C. Acetic acid C lies very close to a\ud
crystallographic centre of symmetry. To avoid overlap the\ud
two repeats cannot exist together and are subject to 50%\ud
statistical disorder. O(1C) of this methanol is furthest from\ud
the two-fold axis and its occupancy refines to a value of 1.0\ud
and is assumed to exist alternately as a water oxygen\ud
hydrogen bonding to methanol O(1C) across the two-fold\ud
axis at a distance of 2.775 A °

The structure of 2,7-dibromocryptolepine acetic\ud
acid solvate, C16H11N2Br2 [1.5(C2H4O2)][C2H3O2\ud
-]\ud
[0.5H2O], Mr = 460.17, has been determined from X-ray\ud
diffraction data. The crystals are monoclinic, space group\ud
P21/c with Z = 4 molecules per unit cell and a =\ud
7.3243(3), b = 18.7804(6), c = 15.8306(7) A ° , b = 94.279(1) ,\ud
Vc = 2171.5(2) A ° , crystal density Dc = 1.667 g/cm3. The\ud
structure was determined using direct methods and refined\ud
by full-matrix least-squares to a conventional R-index of\ud
0.0496 for 4,908 reflections and 258 parameters. The cryptolepine\ud
nucleus of the 2,7-dibromocryptolepine molecule\ud
is highly planar and the two Br atoms are in this plane\ud
within 0.06 and 0.01 A ° , respectively. The crystal structure\ud
is maintained via hydrogen bonding between N(10) in the\ud
cryptolepine nucleus and the oxygen of one of the three\ud
solvated acetic acid molecules. The acetic acid molecules\ud
also form hydrogen bonded chains. Acetic acid B is\ud
deprotonated and its two C¿O bond lengths are equivalent,\ud
unlike those in A and C. Acetic acid C lies very close to a\ud
crystallographic centre of symmetry. To avoid overlap the\ud
two repeats cannot exist together and are subject to 50%\ud
statistical disorder. O(1C) of this methanol is furthest from\ud
the two-fold axis and its occupancy refines to a value of 1.0\ud
and is assumed to exist alternately as a water oxygen\ud
hydrogen bonding to methanol O(1C) across the two-fold\ud
axis at a distance of 2.775 A ° .</dc:description><dc:date>
